sub_title: Senior Research Fellow INVEST flagship, University of Turku, Developmental Psychology
summary: Lydia Laninga-Wijnen did her PhD (defense at November 27, 2020) at the department of Interdisciplinary Social Sciences, Utrecht University, The Netherlands. She worked as postdoc at the University of Groningen, Department of Sociology, where she evaluated the Meaningful Roles program, which aims at reducing bullying in elementary schools. She recently received a Rubicon grant and has become senior research fellow at the University of Turku, where she will investigate whether being defended helps or hurts victims of bullying.
